Summary: ​Interface between 1GX and GoA business applications
Description:
The 1GX Application Programming Interface (API) Service provides Government of Alberta (GoA) business areas with multiple interfaces between 1GX modules and their business applications. It provides them with the ability to search, create, update, and delete records in real time, directly from their business applications, without accessing 1GX directly.

This service must be requested by 1GX ministry service managers, as they are responsible for the integrations between 1GX and ministry applications. They will work with application developers, the 1GX Centre of Excellence (CoE) team, and the Service Integration team to determine which API(s) will meet business area requirements.

The 1GX CoE team approves requests for this service and collaborates with the Service Integration team to collect the requirements needed to configure API Gateway access and security roles
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through BERNIE: search and select the BERNIE service called '1GX API Service'.
Prerequisites: The application is required to be in the CMDB.
Comments: Requests for this service will only be accepted by your ministry's 1GX Service Manager through a BERNIE RITM.
Controller: API does not store content so not applicable. The solution that uses the API will require IC (DM or delegated role, often at the program ED/Director level).

Summary: Interface between 1GX and GoA business applications using legacy IMAGIS
Description: ​Interfaces between 1GX and GoA business applications using iSuite to send/receive files in legacy IMAGIS format. This integration is for legacy GoA applications, it will be phased out and replaced by direct API type of integration with 1GX. ​
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through BERNIE; search and select the BERNIE service called '1GX Legacy IMAGIS Integration Service'.
Prerequisites: The application is required to be in the CMDB.
Comments: This integration is for legacy GoA applications, it will be phased out and replaced by direct API type of integration with 1GX. ​
Controller: Interface does not store content so not applicable. The overall solution will require IC (DM or delegated role, often at the program ED/Director level).

Summary: Deployment of Keycloak for user authentication and authorization.
Description: The Access Service is a deployment of Keycloak, which provides Realms to tenants and serves as the basis for user access management.  As a federated IDP, Keycloak provides user authentication and authorization services, helping you to your tenant secure.  On top of Keycloak, the Access Service provides the user roles necessary to use all other ADSP services.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Summary: Find an address and autopopulate address details using incremental Canada Post searches.
Description: Allows ease of mailing address data entry and validation through 2 endpoints that allow incremental searches to find the correct address and provide the full address details of the selected result.  This service leverages "Canada Post - Address Complete" for it's validation repository.
ContactDetails: Users are to contact the Service Integration Team via BERNIE to request this service.
Controller: Brad Wile(Director, Information Technology,  Legal Aid Alberta)

Summary: DayJS plugin with information about stat holidays in Alberta.
Description: A DayJS plugin for the information about statutory holidays in Alberta

Summary: Verify new borns and deceased individuals using Alberta Vital Statistics.

Controller: Director, Business & Vital Event Registries, Service Alberta

Summary: IAM platform for federated sign on and identity verification for citizens accessing online services.

Summary: Monitoring and performance metrics for APIs with firewall, router, and DDOS protection.
Description: Provides protection, monitoring and performance metrics for APIs.  The gateway can act as a firewall, router & DDOS protection for APIs and supports advanced features like "custom claims".  The gateway service is available for both internal/external and on-prem/cloud APIs.  This service leverages the Digital Identiity Gateway for API authentication.

Summary: Guide for developers and QA testers to get started with QA automation within the application.
Description:
This is QA automation process outlined for service teams. Developers and QA testers should be able to use this as a guide to get started with QA automation within your application.

This documentation will go over all of the QA automation test frameworks in detail, outline the technology stacks used in this process

Summary: Using Amazon QuickSight, create interactive dashboards, reports, and embedded analytics with single source of truth.
Description:
Justice Digital teams are using Amazon QuickSight as a data visualization tool. With QuickSight, all product teams can meet varying analytic needs from the same source of truth through interactive dashboards, paginated reports, and embedded analytics. 

Product teams are also fully automating their Data Pipelines using a shared architecture pattern.
DataIssues: Are Amazon QuickSight and shared architecture framework strategy 2 very different and unrelated things?

ADSP gives you full backend support for creating persistent events, managing attendees, event queries, and automatic time-zone conversion.  It can be used to populate any front-end calendar widget with daily, weekly, or monthly entries.

Description: Cloud native is the software approach of building, deploying, and managing modern applications in cloud computing environments. Modern companies want to build highly scalable, flexible, and resilient applications that they can update quickly to meet customer demands.

The service ensures persistent, and schema-compliant, configuration storage using a JSON document store. Write operations will be validated against the schema for accurate and consistent data.

Summary: Interface for accessing information regarding course marks from Alberta Education.
Description: Interface is utilized by Advanced Education to pull information regarding course marks from Alberta Education. This information is used for a variety of purposes including Rutherford Scholarship eligibility and as a shared secret for authenticatio purposes in SIAMS.

Summary: Allows Justice Digital staff to lookup for metadata, contact information and court locations.
Description:
The court personnel API allows Justice Digital service/teams to look up metadata, contact information regarding Justices, Judges, Judicial Assistants, Application Judges and their court locations at any point in the service.

Metadata and contact information for Judges, Justices, Judicial assistants, and Application Judges are collected and updated in a single place.

Signatures of Justices and Clerks are managed within the Shared Service and through secure access, can be applied to documents as required.

 The shared service serves as the source of truth for this information, where delegated authorities from the courts update information for all other services and systems to pull from.
Considerations: IMP consult re: electronic signatures may be needed.

Summary: Data governance plan outlining processes and procedures to ensure data quality, security, and privacy across all shared services within Justice Digital's services platform.
Description: The Data Governance Plan outlines the processes and procedures to ensure data quality, security, and privacy across all shared services of the Justice Digital Services Platform. It comprises a set of standard operating procedures (SOPs) aimed at promoting consistency, reliability, and compliance in the handling, management, and modification of shared services.

Summary: A design system for designers and developers to create consistent and cohesive user experiences across multiple products and platforms.
Description: The Design System team is responsible for creating and maintaining the assets used for building DDD product layouts, interactions, and patterns. The design system is a shared language for designers and developers to create consistent and cohesive user experiences across multiple products and platforms.
Language: Web components, Design tokens, Angular, React
Version: Web components 1.14.0 , Design tokens 1.1.1 , Angular components 2.5.0 , React components 4.14.0
UseCases: A design system is a centralized resource that provides guidelines, assets, and code to help teams build digital products. It helps maintain consistency across multiple projects and allows teams to focus on higher-level tasks rather than reinventing low-level elements.
Comments: Include the design system in all DDD products; it should act as the foundation for developing the front-end of any government service.

Summary: Central register of APIs to find service URLs and decouple application code.
Description: As a central register of APIs, the Directory Service gives you a means for service discovery.  They can use the Directory Service to find service URLs and decouple application code from changes in the URL due to, for example, a newer version, or a change in the application's environment.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Summary: Document manipulation features like mail merges, PDF form filling and PDF redaction.
Description: Provides a number of document manipulation features including:  Mail Merges, PDF Form Filling and PDF Redaction.  This service supports a number of input and output formats (.docx, .xlsx, pdf, etc.)  -->  Enhancement requests can be made for additional features
ContactDetails: Users are to contact the Service Integration Team via BERNIE to request this service.
Considerations: CMO - Forms teams may need to be consulted.

Summary: ECM connector for basic file management of project-specific content within ECM systems for OpenText.
Description:
The Electronic Content Management (ECM) Connector is a representational state transfer (REST) application programming interface (API) that allows file management of Government of Alberta (GoA) content within ECM systems (e.g. file creation, modification, metadata, etc.).

The ECM Connector takes REST calls and translates them into a format that is understood by the proprietary Open Text LIVELINK web services (LAPI) running on the GoA’s OpenText Enterprise Content Servers (ECSS) server.
Prerequisites: Advanced request required through the Service Integration team via BERNIE

Summary: Create and send documents for e-signatures to GoA's internal and external clients.
Description:
The eSignature is a cloud-based service that allows subscribers to prepare and send documents for electronic signatures.  With this service, subscribers can send contracts and agreements to both GoA internal and external clients for signatures and approvals.  The service is secure, cost-effective, timesaving, user-friendly, and compliant with GoA guidelines and standards.  The signed documents are protected, and the signers are uniquely identified by using multiple authentication methods.

The following tasks can be performed using this request:

Request a consultation with the eSignature support team
Subscribe to the eSignature service
Add, change, and remove users from your eSignature service subscription
Assign signature projects to users
Cancel the eSignature service subscription
You are encouraged to request a consultation to learn more about the service before subscribing to the service.  During the consultation meeting, you are provided with the service features, costs, and details on the subscription process.
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint Site: Click the 'eSignature - Self-Service User Portal (ConsignO) link. Please refer to the Activity Details in the documentaion for all contact options.
Prerequisites: Users will need to go to the knowledge base article in BERNIE and select subscribe to this service under the Activity Details.
Considerations: IMP consult re: electronic signatures may be requested.

Summary: Email service with features and formatting capabilities similar to Outlook client.
Description: Sends emails to one or many recipients with multiple parameters: To, CC and BCC, ability to specify a FROM recipient, supply a subject line, options for the message body such as HTML, Rich Text or Plain Text, and the sender can attach one or more attachments to the ​email.  Provides similar formatting capabilities as your outlook client.
ContactDetails: Users are to contact the Service Integration Team via BERNIE to request this service.

E.G an application is using the Notification Service it would use specific domain events to trigger notifications.

It includes support for virus scanning, access control, retention policy, retrieval, and searching. The service is intended to give applications a means to manage temporary files (e.g. retention policy < 30 days), or whose content is not directly needed by the application's business users.

Summary: Develop ePDFs and paper forms that meet information collection requirements and standards.
Description: The Forms Development service provides clients access to a comprehensive forms analysis and design service, which ensures the creation of forms that meet business requirements from an information collection and standards perspective. This service also includes consultative support through recommendations or guidance on best practices. Scenarios may range from how to leverage software capabilities and print technologies to best meet the needs of the client, to introduction to vendors and assistance with management of contracted vendor services, if applicable. All electronic forms are placed on the GoA Form Repository for use by GoA staff. This portal also allows access to approved external agencies (e.g. law enforcement, crisis centers).
Considerations:
Completed forms must be stored in compliance with records management policies and procedures.
Consult with CMO-forms may be requested.

Guidebook containing threats, attack consequences, security considerations, and best practices for developing browser-based apps that use OAuth 2.0

Summary: Payment gateway service offering a centralized electronic payment experience.
Description:
The Payment Gateway Service (PGS) offers a centralized electronic payment experience with the GoA using the TD Online Mart online payments solution. This standardized approach has many advantages over direct integration with current payment providers, such as:  

Application insulation from organizational change. When the payment provider changes, the application code does not. Consequently, PGS can seamlessly manage a new payment provider without manual intervention. 
Business areas no longer have to complete the Payment Card Industry Self-Assessment Questionnaire (PCI SAQ) A type audits.
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; click the 'Service Integration Consultation' Request web form.
Prerequisites: Business area will require a merchant account for their transactions.  This can be obtained through TBF merchant services (the process to obtain a merchant account is documented as part of the onboarding procedures)
Considerations: SARTR Merchant Services engagement required before use merchantservices@gov.ab.ca

Summary: Splunk as an event management and correlation software for a holistic view of a service through dashboards, reports, and alerts.
Description:
Splunk is an advanced and scalable form of software that indexes and searches for log files within a system and analyzes data for operational intelligence. A web-based software platform using real-time processing and provides the Government of Alberta (GoA) business areas with 5 main functions:
 - collect and index,
 - search and investigate,
 - add knowledge,
 - report and visualize,
 - monitor and alert,
on machine data, websites, applications, within the GoA infrastructure.

Summary: Monitoring the health of applications and services.
Description: A service for monitoring the health of applications and other services.  You provide a URL for it to ping and it will notify you, or a webhook, if the response occurs in a timely manner or not.  Additionally, the service provides links to a static web page your users can visit to check on your application's status.  You can configure this page to display status updates and notices for planned maintenance or other outages.

Summary: Temporal-based data store for event, change, and audit logs.
Description: Provides a temporal-based data store that is useful for storing such things as event, change, and audit logs.  In addition, it can be used to aggregate KPI's over some time interval by including metrics along with each entry.  For example, it has been used to log events along with a count metric, and therefore can be used to show how many events are emitted per unit of time.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.
Considerations: IMP Consult re: log management may be requested.

Summary: Time restricted random codes for verification and user access.
Description: Verify service provides time limited random codes that can be used for validation purposes. For example, generated codes can be sent to a user by email and requested from an application to verify user access to the email inbox.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.
